page.title: 09TRADE: Brampton Market
page.content: Brampton became a market town in 1252 when a Market Charter was granted by King Henry III. It has remained a market town ever since and still holds a market in the market square every Wednesday. There are on average about 15 stalls selling such things as clothing, fruit and vegetables, shoes, sweets and confectionary, toys, cheeses and health foods, plants and fresh fish.The local Women's Institute also sells its produce there. The stall holders travel to Brampton from Carlisle, Penrith, Newcastle, Maryport and Gretna as well as the local area.
